page.title: 08The Andrew Hall, Shipley
page.content: Donated by Mrs.Sarah Andrew and built in 1832 as schoolroom/master's house, the Hall under the trusteeship of the Vicar and 2 others with a management committee of 10 is now used by local groups. Shipley & Coolham Seniors Club has just celebrated 21 years.Programme includes outings, speakers, parties, prizewinning handicraft exhibits. Shipley Playgroup is on Tues.& Thurs. "Shipley Social Evenings" provides whist (alt.Thurs.) with charity drives for Blind and disease research."Andrew Hall Social Club's" bingo (alt.Fri.) supports the Hall and other charities. Sunday School is twice a month. Coffee is served after family services and refreshments on Mill Open Days. The Hall is also used for jumble sales, Parish Council meetings and other private and public functions.
